SENT.plain: Gilbert syndrome, a benign unconjugated hyperbilirubinemiawithout structural liver disease or overt hemolysis, is characterizedby episodes of mild intermittent jaundice (1)(2)(3)
Gilbertsyndrome is the most common inherited variant of hepatic bilirubinmetabolism, occurring in 2–12% of the population, and it is oftendetected in adulthood during routine blood tests
The most consistentfeature in Gilbert syndrome is a deficiency in bilirubinglucuronidation, but the metabolism of drugs may also be affected(3)
